strengths: Coexistence mechanic — commit ground forces without triggering combat
Ocean cards gained from coexistence function as 1/1 planet equivalents
Share Knowledge promissory note — lend tech to other players for diplomatic leverage
Radical Advancement — swap techs for higher-tier ones at status phase
Hydrothermal Mining — trade good per ocean card in play
weaknesses: Coexistence means you don't control the planets you coexist on (for most purposes)
Ocean cards are lost if coexistence ends
tips: Use coexistence to spread across the map without triggering wars
Ocean cards provide extra economy — Hydrothermal Mining turns each into a trade good
Share Knowledge makes you a valuable ally — other players want your tech
Radical Advancement lets you swap lower-tier tech for better versions — plan your tech tree around this
Coexisting units count as controlling planets for scoring objectives — powerful for scoring
Starting Dreadnought gives early military presence; use it defensively

techPaths.name: Faction tech focused
techPaths.note: Both faction techs are biotic; Radical Advancement enables tech path flexibility, Hydrothermal Mining provides economy
